page.title: 03Kelly House, West Devon
page.content: Kelly House home of the Kelly family for 900 years. The present squire is the 31st Kelly. Part of the Elizabethan house remains. First floor converted into a large flat. New house built on in Georgian period with fine south facade. Victorian wing added part now of a ground floor flat. Old stabling and coadh house partly converted to one flat. Fabric of house badly weathered, in need of repair. Stone buildings delapidated. Still standing a brick built granary and 4 staddle stones. Garden grounds and 12 acres farmland (let). Path through shrubberyleads to Kelly church. 25 generations baptised here. Present family, widow of 30th squire, teaches art and runs picture framing business, squire, architect, wife and daughter, married daughter and 2 children. Second son deceased.
